ï»¿For birds, the first priority is to safeguard their eggs.
To other animals, they're a desirable snack.
The eggs themselves are minor miracles.
A microscopic egg cell is planted on a globule of yolk.
Waiting for it in the egg duct are stored sperm.
One of which fertilizes the egg as it passes.
After several hours, it reaches the line producing section of the duct.
Over 24 hours, the hard shell is built up.
Finally, a pigment gland squirts out spots of color and an avocet produces her egg.
